mdxSource.renderedOutput:
Garlic chilli chicken curry is all about the red/green chillies, garlic and the spices, cooked british indian restaurant style, in a luxurious gravy. It's what makes it currylicious...

Its great with Naan Bread served as a side.

I just love this recipe. Succulent pieces of Chicken, in a hot chilli sauce. The secret is to either marinade the chicken, or to poach it in a base sauce. Its a regular weekend treat. Prawns can be added to the last 5-10 minutes of the cook to add more deliciousness.

The recipe is authentic, and fairly easy to make. If you like garlic and a spicky kick to your curries then this is the one for you.

Using a base sauce is the secret to getting this to BIR standard. It helps give the flavour and texture.

2 options to prepare the meat

  1. Marinate the chicken, and tandoori it.
  2. Pre-cook the meat

My secret is to marinade the chicken for 24hrs in a mixture of spices then tandoori it, or poach the chicken breasts whole in my special spicy broth mixture. This is what most restaurants do.

Pre-cook method

Pre-cooking is used in restaurants as it make the meat tender, but also makes it faster and tastier.

I use a pre-cook method mostly. This involves poaching the chicken breasts whole in a special spicy broth mixture, then removing them from the broth, allowing it to cool. The breasts are then cut into large chunks, (always cut across the breast). When added for the last 5-10 minutes to literally warm through, the chicken soaks up the spices making the meat even more tender, spicy and yummy!
